Class TestData

java.lang.Object
education.the_software_toolsmith.testing.framework.TestData
public class TestData extends Object
Utility class for testing: data collection manipulations.
Since:
5.6
Version:
1.0 2018-05-25 initial set of tests, 1.1 2018-06-09 revise structure to use TestInfo instead of certain hard-coded text, 1.2 2018-09-02 add timeouts, 1.3 2019-01-14 more implementation, 1.3.1 2019-01-17 cosmetic changes, 2.0 2019-05-12
  • restructure tests
  • disable System.exit() during testing
  • start making each subtest independent so they'll all run even if one fails
, 2.1 2019-05-17
  • rename class
  • remove unnecessary throws clauses from @BeforeXxx and @AfterXxx
  • more fully utilize JUnit 5.4 features
  • switch tests to data-driven
, 3.0 2019-06-27
  • complete re-write with reusable testing infrastructure
  • tests are now data-driven
  • add summary test results
, 3.1 2019-06-28 move detailed activity to log file, 4.0 2019-07-04 split general purpose utilities methods into separate class, 5.0 2019-10-07 revise for Stack ADT, 5.1 2020-01-26 cleanup toward DRCo coding standard compliance, 5.2 2020-05-14
  • cleanup comments
  • enhance null argument handling
  • in parseArguments(): correct numeric range bounds parsing; add support for data-supplied step, repeating group count, duplicate count
  • output formatting adjustments to improve alignment and readability
  • add PlaceholderException to support specific Exception detection
  • add support for detection and display of boolean/Boolean and char/Character types
, 5.3 2020-06-03 add startTest() pass-through for backward compatibility, 5.4 2020-07-22
  • add instance field retrieval and modification methods
  • add method invocation support
, 5.5 2020-08-07
  • consolidate/simplify field access methods
  • add collection retrieval methods
  • enhance itemToString()
  • add itemToStringWithType()
, 5.6 2021-04-11 Repackage as canned utility testing suite, 5.7 2021-06-19
  • remove dependencies upon JUnit
  • enhance countOccurances() to count matching nulls
, 5.8 2021-08-05 enhance itemToString(), 5.9 2021-11-18 enhance compareArray() to test for equal or identical contents, 5.10 2025-01-26 recode if/else in itemToString() to use switch for clarity, 5.11 2025-02-28
  • change default condition in itemToString() to leave 'other' types to their own devices based on their toString()
  • enable main()
, 5.12 2025-03-09 minor cosmetic changes to main() and itemToString(), 5.13 2025-03-15 replace remaining item.toString() with itemToString( item ) for consistency, 6.0 2025-03-17
  • replace remaining toString()s with itemToString(), except for StringBuilder instances, for more consistent formatting
  • remove conditional logic to format null as "null" in all methods except itemToString()}
  • generalizations to prepare to support additional collection types
    • rename/remove compareArrays() methods to corresponding compareDatasets()
    • rename/remove arrayToString() and its variants to corresponding datasetToString() equivalents
    • rename/remove arrayContains() to datasetContains()
, 6.0.1 2025-07-18 swap operands to '==' and '!=' when comparing against a constant so the constant is the left operand
Author:
David M Rosenberg

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final boolean
    COMPARE_EQUALITY
    flag that dataset comparison should test for equal, not identical, instances - paired with COMPARE_IDENTITY
    static final boolean
    COMPARE_IDENTITY
    flag that dataset comparison should test for identical instances, implicitly equal - paired with COMPARE_EQUALITY
    static final int
    DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_ELEMENTS
    the default number of elements datasetToString() will include in truncated text
    static final int
    DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_LENGTH
    default maximum length (in characters) a text version of a dataset can take before the text is truncated in the middle
    static final boolean
    IS_ORDERED
    flag that dataset is ordered and may not be reordered for comparison - paired with IS_UNORDERED
    static final boolean
    IS_UNORDERED
    flag that dataset is unordered and may be reordered for comparison - paired with IS_ORDERED

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_LENGTH

      public static final int DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_LENGTH
      default maximum length (in characters) a text version of a dataset can take before the text is truncated in the middle
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_ELEMENTS

      public static final int DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_ELEMENTS
      the default number of elements datasetToString() will include in truncated text
      See Also:

    • IS_ORDERED

      public static final boolean IS_ORDERED
      flag that dataset is ordered and may not be reordered for comparison - paired with IS_UNORDERED
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public static final boolean IS_UNORDERED
      flag that dataset is unordered and may be reordered for comparison - paired with IS_ORDERED

      public static final boolean COMPARE_EQUALITY
      flag that dataset comparison should test for equal, not identical, instances - paired with COMPARE_IDENTITY

      public static final boolean COMPARE_IDENTITY

  • Method Details

    • datasetToString

      public static String datasetToString(Object[] theDataset)
      Return a limited portion of a text representation of a dataset
      Parameters:
      theDataset - the dataset to convert to text
      Returns:
      the result of datasetToString( theDataset, DEFAULT_DATASET_TO_STRING_LENGTH )
      Since:
      6.0

    • datasetToString

      public static String datasetToString(Object[] theDataset, int maximumLength, int maximumElements)
      Return a limited portion of a text representation of a dataset
      Parameters:
      theDataset - the dataset to convert to text
      maximumLength - the maximum number of characters to return
      maximumElements - the maximum number of elements to return
      Returns:
      if the full text representation has no more than maximumLength characters, the full text; otherwise the first maximumElements / 2 elements followed by " ... " then the last maximumElements / 2 elements
      Since:
      6.0

    • datasetToFullString

      public static String datasetToFullString(Object[] theDataset)
      Create a text representation of a dataset similar to Arrays.toString() but with items appropriately formatted and delimited (e.g. Strings appear within "")
      Parameters:
      theDataset - the items to include in the resulting text
      Returns:
      text representing the appropriately delimited elements of theDataset
      Since:
      6.0

    • itemToStringWithType

      public static String itemToStringWithType(Object item)
      Convert an item to its text representation, delimited appropriately prefixed with the (component) type
      Parameters:
      item - the object to convert
      Returns:
      if item is null, "null" without delimiters, otherwise, the appropriately delimited object's String representation
      Since:
      5.5

    • itemToString

      public static String itemToString(Object item)
      Convert an item to its text representation, delimited appropriately
      Parameters:
      item - the object to convert
      Returns:
      if item is null, "null" without delimiters, otherwise, the appropriately delimited object's String representation
      Since:
      5.4

    • compareDatasets

      public static void compareDatasets(Object[] expected, Object[] actual, boolean ordered) throws TestingException
      Determine if two datasets contain the same contents (equals() - convenience method for backward compatibility
      Parameters:
      expected - the dataset of elements as they should appear
      actual - the dataset of elements to be verified against expected
      ordered - if true, elements of expected and actual must appear in the same order; if false, the contents may appear in any order
      Throws:
      TestingException - when an operation (e.g., comparison) fails, indicates the nature of the failure
      Since:
      6.0

    • compareDatasets

      public static void compareDatasets(Object[] expected, Object[] actual, boolean ordered, boolean compareEquality) throws TestingException
      Determine if two datasets contain the same contents
      Parameters:
      expected - the dataset of elements as they should appear
      actual - the dataset of elements to be verified against expected
      ordered - if true, elements of expected and actual must appear in the same order; if false, the contents may appear in any order
      compareEquality - if true, elements of expected and actual will be compared using equals(); if false, the comparison will use ==
      Throws:
      TestingException - when an operation (e.g., comparison) fails, indicates the nature of the failure
      Since:
      6.0

    • countOccurrences

      public static int countOccurrences(Object[] values, Object testValue)
      Count the number of occurrences of a value in a dataset

      Note: a null dataset element will match an argument of null

      Parameters:
      values - the collection of values
      testValue - the test value
      Returns:
      the number of times testValue occurred in values
      Since:
      5.7

    • datasetContains

      public static boolean datasetContains(Object[] values, Object testValue)
      Determine if testValue occurs at least once in a dataset

      this method will safely search for null

      Parameters:
      values - the collection of values
      testValue - the value to look for
      Returns:
      true if at least one occurrence; false if no occurrences
      Since:
      6.0

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Test driver
      Parameters:
      args - -unused-
